params.taskDescription:
Suppose you’re about to draw one tile from the bag. Find <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>the letter is R</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P({\text{the letter is R}})</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>P</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>the letter is R</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mo stretchy="false">|</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext>the point value is 1</mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">P({\text{the letter is R}}|{\text{the point value is 1}})</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription: If your friend offers you a bet where they pay you $10 if you draw a vowel from the bag, but you owe them $5 if you draw a consonant, should you take it? How do you know?

questionSetStimulus: Each of the following exercises involve drawing a Scrabble tile from a bag. These tiles are labeled with a letter and a point value, as follows: A(1), C(3), D(2), E(1), E(1), J(8), K(5), O(1), R(1), R(1).
